page.title: 03FARMING, FISHING
page.content: There is fishing as well as work on the land.Nowadays fishing is restricted to the inshore type,when in the Autumn during late September small boats called skiffs fish for herring along the coast.When the catch is brought in some of it is sold on the quay but the rest goes to the fish factory where they are processed.First they are stored in barrels with salt, and then they are taken out and smoked.They are then packed for the markets,and some are shipped as far away as France and Italy. 15 boats between 20 and 30 feet in size catch the herring. The prices vary from year to year. In 1982 a cran cost Â£25, in 1983 Â£20 and in 1984 a cran cost Â£22. A cran is four boxes.
